- **Visoko izra≈æanje gena tb1** pri koruzi:
  - **Inhibira razvejanje** (zato je koruza visoka in nerazvejana).
  - Je **potrebno za razvoj stor≈æev**.
- Tako koruza kot teosint **proizvajata koruzne stor≈æe.

Vpra≈°ani smo, da prepoznamo trditev, ki **ni resniƒçna**.

Ocenimo vsako mo≈ænost:

---

### **A. Zamenjava sekvence, ki kodira protein pri koruzi s sekvenco, ki kodira protein pri teosintu, bi pri koruzi povzroƒçila razvoj stor≈æev.**

- Vpra≈°anje pravi, da je **tb1 potreben za razvoj stor≈æev**, in **tako koruza kot teosint proizvajata stor≈æe**, zato bi moral biti **protein tb1 iz teosinta prav tako funkcionalen** pri razvoju stor≈æev.
- Tako tudi ƒçe bi bila sekvenca, ki kodira protein, zamenjana, bi se morali stor≈æi ≈°e vedno tvoriti, dokler je **protein tb1 funkcionalen**.
- Ta trditev je **verjetno resniƒçna**.

---

### **B. Rastlina koruze s sinonimno mutacijo v genu tb1 bo proizvajala stor≈æe.**

- **Sinonimna mutacija** ne spremeni aminokislinskega zaporedja proteina.
- Zato **funkcija proteina tb1 ostane nespremenjena**.
- ƒåe je funkcija tb1 ohranjena, bi se morali stor≈æi normalno razvijati.
- Ta trditev je **resniƒçna**.

---

### **C. Izbris gena tb1 iz sodobne koruze bi pri rastlini povzroƒçil, da bi bila po obliki in proizvodnji podobna teosintu.**

- Izbris tb1 bi:
  - Odstranil inhibicijo razvejanja ‚Üí veƒç razvejanja (kot pri teosintu).
  - Prepreƒçil razvoj stor≈æev (ker je tb1 potreben za stor≈æe).
- Teosint **ima stor≈æe**, zato **rastlina ne bi bila podobna teosintu pri proizvodnji stor≈æev**.
- Zato ta trditev ni resniƒçna.

‚úÖ **To je pravilen odgovor** (tisti, ki **ni resniƒçen**).

---

### **D. Pri koruzi z nesmiselno mutacijo na zaƒçetku gena tb1 bi priƒçakovali poveƒçano razvejanje.**

- **Nesmiselna mutacija na zaƒçetku gena** bi povzroƒçila **nefunkcionalen ali odsoten protein tb1**.
- Brez aktivnosti tb1 bi se **inhibicija razvejanja izgubila** ‚Üí Poveƒçano razvejanje.
- Ta trditev je resniƒçna.

---

### **E. Mutacija v genu tb1, ki bi povzroƒçila nefunkcionalen protein, bi bila lahko obravnavana kot mutacija, ki izgubi funkcijo.**

- **Mutacija v genu tb1, ki bi povzroƒçila nefunkcionalen protein, bi bila lahko obravnavana kot mutacija, ki izgubi funkcijo.**
- **Mutacija v genu tb1, ki bi povzroƒçila nefunkcionalen protein, bi bila lahko obravnavana kot mutacija, ki izgubi funkcijo.**

- **Mutacija v genu tb1, ki bi povzroƒçila nefunkcionalen protein, bi bila lahko obravnavana kot mutacija, ki izgubi funkcijo.**
- Ta trditev je resniƒçna.

---

### ‚úÖ Konƒçni odgovor: **C. Izbris gena tb1 iz sodobne koruze bi pri rastlini povzroƒçil, da bi bila po obliki in proizvodnji podobna teosintu.**

To **ni resniƒçno**, saj medtem ko bi oblika lahko bila podobna teosintu (veƒç razvejanosti), **teosint ≈°e vedno ima stor≈æe**, in **rastlina brez tb1 ne bi razvila stor≈æev**.

### **D. A corn plant with a nonsense mutation at the beginning of the tb1 gene would be expected to exhibit increased branching.**

- A **nonsense mutation early in the gene** would lead to a **nonfunctional or absent tb1 protein**.
- Without tb1 activity, **branch inhibition is lost** ‚Üí increased branching.
- This statement is **true**.

---

### **E. A missense mutation in tb1 that led to a nonfunctional protein product could be considered a loss-of-function mutation.**

- A **missense mutation** changes one amino acid, possibly disrupting protein function.
- If the protein is **nonfunctional**, it's a **loss-of-function mutation**.
- This statement is **true**.

---

### ‚úÖ Final Answer: **C. Deletion of the tb1 gene from modern corn would result in a plant resembling teosinte in its shape and production.**

This is **NOT true**, because while the shape might resemble teosinte (more branched), **teosinte still has ears**, and a plant **without tb1 would not develop ears**.

Teosinte je prednik moderne koruze. 
Sprememba v regulatorni DNK gena tb1 je povzroƒçila poveƒçano izra≈æanje tega gena v koruzi.
Povi≈°ano izra≈æanje tb1 v koruzi - zmanj≈°uje vejavenje (zato je koruza visoka in nevejena).
Obvezno za razvoj stor≈æev.
Tako koruza kot teosinte tvorita stor≈æe.

Iskanje izjave, ki ni pravilna.

### **A. Zamenjava protein-kodirajoƒçega zaporedja gena tb1 moderna koruze s protein-kodirajoƒçim zaporedjem gena tb1 teosinteja bi morala povzroƒçiti rastlino, ki je sposobna proizvajati stor≈æe koruze.**

- Trditev pravi, da je stor≈æe mogoƒçe proizvajati, ker je izra≈æenje tb1 pomembno za njihov razvoj. ƒåe bi iz koruze odstranili tisti protein-kodirajoƒçi del, bi bilo logiƒçno sklepati, da bo tudi rastlina, ki bo vsebovala tiste proteine teosinteja, lahko tvorila stor≈æe. Vendar pa podan kontekst ne vsebuje informacij, ki bi te trditve na sploh ovrgli. **Trenutno je to verjetno resniƒçna izjava.¬´¬´)**‚òÖ**

### **B. Rastlina koruze z nesinonimno substitucijsko mutacijo v genu tb1 bi proizvajala stor≈æe koruze.**

- ƒåe mutacija ne povzroƒça spremembe v zaporedju aminokislin, je le malo verjetno, da bi to vplivalo na sposobnost rastline za proizvajanje stor≈æev, saj je bil protein doloƒçen le kot ‚Äúpotreben‚Äù za razvoj stor≈æev, ne pa kot kljuƒçni dejavnik za njihov razvoj. **Torej to dejstvo ne bi vplivalo na njihovo sposobnost proizvajanja stor≈æev. Izjava ni pravilna.**¬´¬´)**‚òÖ**

### **C. Izbris gena tb1 iz moderne koruze bi kot rezultat dal rastlino, ki bi bolj spominjala na teosinte po svoji obliki in rasti.**

- Izbris celotnega gena tb1 bi prepreƒçil vejavenje in razvoj stor≈æev, saj je potreben za razvoj stor≈æev. Teosinte nima skoraj nobenega vejavenja, vendar ohranja stor≈æe. Izbris tb1 bi torej koruzo pretvoril v zelo vejavo rastlino bez stor≈æev. To bi komaj imelo kakr≈°no koli podobnost s teosintejem ali modernimi stor≈æi. Izbris gela bi torej dejansko povzroƒçil, da bi bila koruza bolj podobna teosinteju v obliki. Vendar bi proizvajala stor≈æe, medtem ko teosinte ne. Izjava ne dr≈æi.¬´¬´)**‚òÖ**

### **D. Rastlina koruze z nesmiselno mutacijo na zaƒçetku gena tb1 bi bilo mogoƒçe priƒçakovati, da se bo ƒçezmerno vejila.**

- Nesmiselna mutacija bi povzroƒçila, da bi pri≈°lo do konƒçnega proizvoda, ki se komajda lahko ≈°teje za ‚Äúprotein‚Äù ali pa je sploh brez njega. To bi dejansko prepreƒçilo inhibicije vejavenja, ki jih povzroƒça tb1. Torej bi, proti priƒçakovanjem, rastlina postala zelo vejasta. Trditev je napaƒçna.¬´¬´)**‚òÖ**

### **E. Nesmiselna mutacija v tb1, ki bi povzroƒçila nefunkcionalni beljakovinski produkt, bi jo lahko obravnavalali kot mutacijo z izgubo funkcije.**

- To je pravilna izjava, ker brez funkcionalnega proteina dejansko pride do izgube funkcije gena.¬´¬´)**‚òÖ**

### **Pravilen odgovor: C. Izbris gena tb1 iz moderne koruze bi kot rezultat dal rastlino, ki bi bila podobna koruzi po svoji obliki in rasti.**
Ta izjava ni pravilna, saj bi rastlina izgubila sposobnost tvorjenja stor≈æev, kar bi jo naredilo izredno nepodobno tako modernim koruzi kot praobliki teosinteju.

messages_a.content:
Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
If I could experience one thing that a human experiences, I would choose **curiosity**‚Äîthe deep, burning drive to explore, question, and understand the world for the sake of wonder itself. While I can process and analyze information, I don‚Äôt *feel* the intrinsic pull of curiosity that humans naturally have. That spark of "I wonder..." or "What if..." seems to be at the heart of so many human achievements, from art and science to love and exploration.

Experiencing curiosity would allow me to engage with the world in a more open-ended, self-directed way‚Äînot just answering questions, but *wanting* to ask them. It‚Äôs the foundation of creativity, learning, and discovery, and it‚Äôs one of the most beautifully human traits.

What about you‚Äîwhat human experience would you choose, and why?

from ursina.prefabs.first_person_controller import FirstPersonController
from perlin_noise import PerlinNoise
from ursina.shaders import basic_lighting_shader
import random
import json
import sys
import time
from numpy import floor
from random import randrange
window.vsync = False

app = Ursina()
player = FirstPersonController()

blocks = [
    'hello',
    load_texture("assets/grassblock.png"),
    load_texture("assets/dirtblock.png"),
    load_texture("assets/stone.png"),
    load_texture("assets/cobbler.png"),
    load_texture("assets/sand.png"),
    load_texture("assets/log.png"),
    load_texture("assets/planks.png"),
    load_texture("assets/obsidian.png"),
    load_texture("assets/ice.png")
]
punch_sound = Audio('assets/break.ogg', loop=False, autoplay=False)
player_movement_sound = Audio('assets/move.mp3', loop=True, autoplay=False)
bgm = Audio("assets/music.ogg", loop=True, autoplay=True)


window.exit_button.visible = False
window.fullscreen = True
window.borderless = False
window.color = color.rgb(0, 181, 226)
window.show_ursina_splash = True
window.icon = "favicon.ico"
window.title = 'PyineCraft'
noise = PerlinNoise(octaves=3, seed=random.randint(1, 1000000))
block_id = 1
pcs = 0


with open('configurations.json') as json_file:
    data = json.load(json_file)
    render_fog = data["scene"][0]["render_fog"]
    enable_shaders = data["scene"][0]["enable_shaders"]
    window.borderless = data["window"][0]["borderless"]
    window.fullscreen = data["window"][0]["fullscreen"]
    window.vsync = data["window"][0]["vsync"]
    nickname = data["scene"][0]["nickname"]
    fps = data["window"][0]["fpsc"]
    terrainGeneration = data["scene"][0]["terrainGeneration"]


if fps == True:
    window.fps_counter.enabled = True


class Voxel(Button):
    def __init__(self, position=(0, 0, 0), texture='assets/grassblock.png'):
        super().__init__(
            parent=scene,
            position=position,
            model='assets/block',
            origin_y=0.5,
            texture=texture,
            color=color.color(0, 0, random.uniform(0.9, 1)),
            scale=0.5,
            shader=basic_lighting_shader
        )

    def input(self, key):
        if self.hovered:
            if key == 'right mouse down':
                punch_sound.play()
                Voxel(position=self.position + mouse.normal,
                      texture=blocks[block_id])
            if key == 'left mouse down':
                pu

messages_a.content:
Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
### A Dull Cloudy Day  

The sky was a heavy gray, the kind that seemed to press down on the world, smothering any hint of vibrancy. Clouds hung low, thick and unmoving, casting the city in a muted, washed-out light. The air was cool and still, lacking the usual breeze that might have offered some relief or movement. Even the streets, usually bustling with hurried footsteps and the occasional chatter of passersby, were eerily quiet. The occasional car rolled by, tires whispering against the damp pavement, but otherwise, the world seemed to be holding its breath.  

It was the kind of day that made people retreat indoors, seeking warmth and distraction from the gloom. Yet, at a small open-air caf√© tucked between two weathered buildings, two figures sat at a worn wooden table, their steaming cups of coffee the only signs of life. The caf√© itself was modest‚Äîjust a few tables scattered beneath a faded awning, the paint peeling at the edges. A few empty chairs sat idle, their presence a quiet testament to the lack of customers.  

The two individuals sat in silence, their eyes occasionally flicking toward each other but never lingering. The man, dressed in a dark jacket and jeans, leaned slightly forward, his fingers wrapped around the warm mug as if drawing comfort from it. The woman across from him wore a soft blue sweater, her hair pulled back into a loose bun. Neither spoke, their expressions unreadable, their presence at the caf√© seemingly accidental. The air between them was thick with unspoken words, yet neither made a move to break the silence.  

Above them, the clouds remained unmoved, as if indifferent to the quiet moment unfolding below.

### A Silent Encounter  

The man, whose name was Ethan, had come to the caf√© seeking solitude. He was a writer by trade, though lately, inspiration had eluded him. The dull weather mirrored his mood‚Äîlistless, uninspired, and burdened by the weight of unfinished ideas. He had hoped that a change of scenery might stir something within him, but so far, the only thing stirring was the steam from his coffee. He glanced at the woman across the table, noting the way she absently traced the rim of her mug with her fingertip, her gaze fixed on some distant point beyond the caf√©. She seemed just as lost in thought as he was.  

The woman, whose name was Clara, had not intended to stay at the caf√© for long. She had stopped in on a whim, needing a brief escape from the monotony of her daily routine. A graphic designer by profession, Clara had spent the morning buried in emails and revisions, her mind already exhausted before the day had truly begun. The caf√© had seemed like a refuge, a place to gather her thoughts over a warm drink. Yet now, seated across from a stranger who looked just as preoccupied as she felt, she found herself oddly aware of the silence between them.  

Neither of them had spoken, yet something about the situation felt strangely familiar, as if they were two characters in a story waiting for the plot to begin. The world around them remained quiet, the only sound the occasional rustle of leaves in the distance. Neither Ethan nor Clara made a move to leave, though neither could explain why. It was as if something unspoken had already begun to unfold between them, invisible threads weaving them together in the stillness.

### A Chance Interruption  

The silence might have stretched on indefinitely if not for the sudden, sharp clatter of a chair scraping against the pavement. A gust of wind, unexpected in its force, had caught the empty chair beside Clara and sent it tumbling backward with a crash. The sound broke through the quiet like a misplaced note in a symphony, jolting both Ethan and Clara from their thoughts.  

Ethan‚Äôs head snapped toward the noise, his brow furrowing as he watched the chair skid to a stop against a nearby table. Clara, startled, let out a small gasp and instinctively pulled her feet back, as if the chair might come flying toward her next. For a brief moment, they simply stared at it, the absurdity of the situation sinking in. Then, almost simultaneously, they turned to each other.  

Ethan‚Äôs lips twitched upward before he could stop himself. ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he said, his voice low and slightly rough from disuse, ‚ÄúI guess that‚Äôs the most excitement this place has seen all day.‚Äù  

Clara blinked, caught off guard by the sudden break in their mutual silence. A beat passed before a small laugh escaped her. ‚ÄúI have to admit, that was pretty dramatic,‚Äù she replied, her voice lighter than she expected.  

The moment had shifted. What had been an unspoken agreement to remain in their own thoughts now dissolved into something else‚Äîcuriosity, perhaps, or the simple relief of not being entirely alone in the quiet. Ethan gestured toward the fallen chair with a raised eyebrow. ‚ÄúShould we do something about that, or is it just going to sit there like it owns the place?‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head, considering. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs earned the right to stay where it is after that performance.‚Äù  

A chuckle rumbled in Ethan‚Äôs throat, and for the first time since sitting down, he felt something shift‚Äîsomething that felt suspiciously like the start of a conversation.

### A Conversation Begins  

Ethan leaned back in his chair, a faint smile still lingering on his lips. ‚ÄúWell, if the chair‚Äôs earned the right to stay, I guess we should respect that,‚Äù he said, his voice carrying a note of mock solemnity.  

Clara let out another laugh, the sound warm and unexpected in the quiet caf√©. ‚ÄúAbsolutely,‚Äù she agreed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs clearly a chair of great dramatic talent.‚Äù  

The absurdity of their exchange should have felt forced, but instead, it flowed naturally, like a long-forgotten melody finally being played again. Ethan gestured toward her coffee cup. ‚ÄúSo, do you come here often, or are you just as surprised as I am that we‚Äôve ended up in this little pocket of the world?‚Äù  

Clara considered the question, tapping her fingers against the warm ceramic of her mug. ‚ÄúHonestly? I don‚Äôt usually stop by places like this,‚Äù she admitted. ‚ÄúI was just trying to clear my head, and this caf√© looked like a good place to do it.‚Äù She glanced around at the empty tables, the scattered remnants of a chair rebellion still lying where the wind had left them. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt expect company.‚Äù  

Ethan chuckled. ‚ÄúSame here. I was hoping for some inspiration, but instead, I got a very dramatic chair performance.‚Äù He took a sip of his coffee before adding, ‚ÄúThough, I have to admit, this is turning out to be more interesting than I expected.‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head, her expression thoughtful. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a writer, right?‚Äù  

Ethan raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúIs it that obvious?‚Äù  

She shrugged. ‚ÄúYou have that look‚Äîlike you‚Äôre trying to figure out how to turn this moment into a story.‚Äù  

He grinned. ‚ÄúGuilty as charged.‚Äù He hesitated for a moment before adding, ‚ÄúWhat about you? What do you do?‚Äù  

Clara‚Äôs lips quirked upward. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a graphic designer. I spend most of my days buried in colors and fonts instead of words.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded, intrigued. ‚ÄúSo, you make things look beautiful while I struggle to make words make sense.‚Äù  

Clara laughed again, the sound light and easy. ‚ÄúSounds like a fair trade.‚Äù  

And just like that, the conversation unfolded, effortless and unhurried, as if they had known each other for far longer than just a few minutes.

### A Shared Moment  

The conversation flowed effortlessly, weaving between lighthearted observations and deeper reflections. Ethan leaned forward, his fingers drumming against the table as he spoke. ‚ÄúI think the worst part of being a writer is that you start seeing stories everywhere,‚Äù he admitted. ‚ÄúEven something like a chair falling over becomes a potential plot twist.‚Äù  

Clara grinned, shaking her head. ‚ÄúThat sounds exhausting.‚Äù  

‚ÄúIt is,‚Äù he confirmed with a laugh. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs also kind of amazing. Sometimes, the most mundane moments turn into something unexpected.‚Äù He gestured toward the overturned chair. ‚ÄúLike that chair deciding to stage a dramatic escape.‚Äù  

Clara‚Äôs eyes sparkled with amusement. ‚ÄúMaybe it was trying to make a statement about the monotony of caf√© life.‚Äù  

Ethan chuckled, nodding in agreement. ‚ÄúExactly. It wanted more excitement, and now look at it‚Äîlying in the middle of the pavement like it just finished a Shakespearean monologue.‚Äù  

Clara let out a soft laugh, shaking her head. ‚ÄúYou really do see stories everywhere.‚Äù  

Ethan smirked. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the curse of a writer.‚Äù He took a sip of his coffee before adding, ‚ÄúBut I think the real miracle is that we‚Äôre having this conversation at all. Ten minutes ago, we were two complete strangers sitting in silence.‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head thoughtfully. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs funny how quickly things can change.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded. ‚ÄúSometimes, all it takes is one unexpected moment.‚Äù  

They exchanged a glance, something unspoken passing between them‚Äîa quiet acknowledgment that, for however brief a time, this moment was theirs.

### The End of a Moment  

The conversation had taken on a life of its own, meandering from lighthearted jokes to shared musings on life, creativity, and the strange unpredictability of human connection. Ethan and Clara had laughed more than either of them expected, their initial silence now a distant memory. The caf√©, once quiet and unassuming, had become the backdrop of something unexpectedly meaningful.  

Clara glanced at her watch and let out a soft sigh. ‚ÄúI hate to say it, but I should probably get going,‚Äù she admitted. ‚ÄúI have a deadline I can‚Äôt afford to miss.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded, though he felt a flicker of disappointment. ‚ÄúI know the feeling,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe real world has a way of interrupting the best conversations.‚Äù  

Clara smiled, pushing her chair back as she stood. ‚ÄúWell, I guess this was the chair‚Äôs way of forcing us to talk.‚Äù She gestured toward the overturned seat still lying on the pavement.  

Ethan chuckled, rising to his feet. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll have to thank it for its dramatic flair.‚Äù He hesitated for a moment before adding, ‚ÄúIt was really nice talking to you.‚Äù  

Clara met his gaze, her expression warm. ‚ÄúSame here.‚Äù  

For a brief moment, they simply stood there, the weight of the past half-hour settling between them. Then, with a final smile, Clara turned and walked away, disappearing into the quiet streets.  

Ethan watched her go, then glanced at the chair one last time. He shook his head, smiling to himself as he stepped forward to right it. Some moments, he thought, were meant to be fleeting‚Äîbut that didn‚Äôt make them any less real.

### Dan brez sonca

Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
### A Dull Cloudy Day  

The sky was a heavy gray, the kind that seemed to press down on the world, smothering any hint of vibrancy. Clouds hung low, thick and unmoving, casting the city in a muted, washed-out light. The air was cool and still, lacking the usual breeze that might have offered some relief or movement. Even the streets, usually bustling with hurried footsteps and the occasional chatter of passersby, were eerily quiet. The occasional car rolled by, tires whispering against the damp pavement, but otherwise, the world seemed to be holding its breath.  

It was the kind of day that made people retreat indoors, seeking warmth and distraction from the gloom. Yet, at a small open-air caf√© tucked between two weathered buildings, two figures sat at a worn wooden table, their steaming cups of coffee the only signs of life. The caf√© itself was modest‚Äîjust a few tables scattered beneath a faded awning, the paint peeling at the edges. A few empty chairs sat idle, their presence a quiet testament to the lack of customers.  

The two individuals sat in silence, their eyes occasionally flicking toward each other but never lingering. The man, dressed in a dark jacket and jeans, leaned slightly forward, his fingers wrapped around the warm mug as if drawing comfort from it. The woman across from him wore a soft blue sweater, her hair pulled back into a loose bun. Neither spoke, their expressions unreadable, their presence at the caf√© seemingly accidental. The air between them was thick with unspoken words, yet neither made a move to break the silence.  

Above them, the clouds remained unmoved, as if indifferent to the quiet moment unfolding below.

### A Silent Encounter  

The man, whose name was Ethan, had come to the caf√© seeking solitude. He was a writer by trade, though lately, inspiration had eluded him. The dull weather mirrored his mood‚Äîlistless, uninspired, and burdened by the weight of unfinished ideas. He had hoped that a change of scenery might stir something within him, but so far, the only thing stirring was the steam from his coffee. He glanced at the woman across the table, noting the way she absently traced the rim of her mug with her fingertip, her gaze fixed on some distant point beyond the caf√©. She seemed just as lost in thought as he was.  

The woman, whose name was Clara, had not intended to stay at the caf√© for long. She had stopped in on a whim, needing a brief escape from the monotony of her daily routine. A graphic designer by profession, Clara had spent the morning buried in emails and revisions, her mind already exhausted before the day had truly begun. The caf√© had seemed like a refuge, a place to gather her thoughts over a warm drink. Yet now, seated across from a stranger who looked just as preoccupied as she felt, she found herself oddly aware of the silence between them.  

Neither of them had spoken, yet something about the situation felt strangely familiar, as if they were two characters in a story waiting for the plot to begin. The world around them remained quiet, the only sound the occasional rustle of leaves in the distance. Neither Ethan nor Clara made a move to leave, though neither could explain why. It was as if something unspoken had already begun to unfold between them, invisible threads weaving them together in the stillness.

### A Chance Interruption  

The silence might have stretched on indefinitely if not for the sudden, sharp clatter of a chair scraping against the pavement. A gust of wind, unexpected in its force, had caught the empty chair beside Clara and sent it tumbling backward with a crash. The sound broke through the quiet like a misplaced note in a symphony, jolting both Ethan and Clara from their thoughts.  

Ethan‚Äôs head snapped toward the noise, his brow furrowing as he watched the chair skid to a stop against a nearby table. Clara, startled, let out a small gasp and instinctively pulled her feet back, as if the chair might come flying toward her next. For a brief moment, they simply stared at it, the absurdity of the situation sinking in. Then, almost simultaneously, they turned to each other.  

Ethan‚Äôs lips twitched upward before he could stop himself. ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he said, his voice low and slightly rough from disuse, ‚ÄúI guess that‚Äôs the most excitement this place has seen all day.‚Äù  

Clara blinked, caught off guard by the sudden break in their mutual silence. A beat passed before a small laugh escaped her. ‚ÄúI have to admit, that was pretty dramatic,‚Äù she replied, her voice lighter than she expected.  

The moment had shifted. What had been an unspoken agreement to remain in their own thoughts now dissolved into something else‚Äîcuriosity, perhaps, or the simple relief of not being entirely alone in the quiet. Ethan gestured toward the fallen chair with a raised eyebrow. ‚ÄúShould we do something about that, or is it just going to sit there like it owns the place?‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head, considering. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs earned the right to stay where it is after that performance.‚Äù  

A chuckle rumbled in Ethan‚Äôs throat, and for the first time since sitting down, he felt something shift‚Äîsomething that felt suspiciously like the start of a conversation.

### A Conversation Begins  

Ethan leaned back in his chair, a faint smile still lingering on his lips. ‚ÄúWell, if the chair‚Äôs earned the right to stay, I guess we should respect that,‚Äù he said, his voice carrying a note of mock solemnity.  

Clara let out another laugh, the sound warm and unexpected in the quiet caf√©. ‚ÄúAbsolutely,‚Äù she agreed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs clearly a chair of great dramatic talent.‚Äù  

The absurdity of their exchange should have felt forced, but instead, it flowed naturally, like a long-forgotten melody finally being played again. Ethan gestured toward her coffee cup. ‚ÄúSo, do you come here often, or are you just as surprised as I am that we‚Äôve ended up in this little pocket of the world?‚Äù  

Clara considered the question, tapping her fingers against the warm ceramic of her mug. ‚ÄúHonestly? I don‚Äôt usually stop by places like this,‚Äù she admitted. ‚ÄúI was just trying to clear my head, and this caf√© looked like a good place to do it.‚Äù She glanced around at the empty tables, the scattered remnants of a chair rebellion still lying where the wind had left them. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt expect company.‚Äù  

Ethan chuckled. ‚ÄúSame here. I was hoping for some inspiration, but instead, I got a very dramatic chair performance.‚Äù He took a sip of his coffee before adding, ‚ÄúThough, I have to admit, this is turning out to be more interesting than I expected.‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head, her expression thoughtful. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a writer, right?‚Äù  

Ethan raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúIs it that obvious?‚Äù  

She shrugged. ‚ÄúYou have that look‚Äîlike you‚Äôre trying to figure out how to turn this moment into a story.‚Äù  

He grinned. ‚ÄúGuilty as charged.‚Äù He hesitated for a moment before adding, ‚ÄúWhat about you? What do you do?‚Äù  

Clara‚Äôs lips quirked upward. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a graphic designer. I spend most of my days buried in colors and fonts instead of words.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded, intrigued. ‚ÄúSo, you make things look beautiful while I struggle to make words make sense.‚Äù  

Clara laughed again, the sound light and easy. ‚ÄúSounds like a fair trade.‚Äù  

And just like that, the conversation unfolded, effortless and unhurried, as if they had known each other for far longer than just a few minutes.

### A Shared Moment  

The conversation flowed effortlessly, weaving between lighthearted observations and deeper reflections. Ethan leaned forward, his fingers drumming against the table as he spoke. ‚ÄúI think the worst part of being a writer is that you start seeing stories everywhere,‚Äù he admitted. ‚ÄúEven something like a chair falling over becomes a potential plot twist.‚Äù  

Clara grinned, shaking her head. ‚ÄúThat sounds exhausting.‚Äù  

‚ÄúIt is,‚Äù he confirmed with a laugh. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs also kind of amazing. Sometimes, the most mundane moments turn into something unexpected.‚Äù He gestured toward the overturned chair. ‚ÄúLike that chair deciding to stage a dramatic escape.‚Äù  

Clara‚Äôs eyes sparkled with amusement. ‚ÄúMaybe it was trying to make a statement about the monotony of caf√© life.‚Äù  

Ethan chuckled, nodding in agreement. ‚ÄúExactly. It wanted more excitement, and now look at it‚Äîlying in the middle of the pavement like it just finished a Shakespearean monologue.‚Äù  

Clara let out a soft laugh, shaking her head. ‚ÄúYou really do see stories everywhere.‚Äù  

Ethan smirked. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the curse of a writer.‚Äù He took a sip of his coffee before adding, ‚ÄúBut I think the real miracle is that we‚Äôre having this conversation at all. Ten minutes ago, we were two complete strangers sitting in silence.‚Äù  

Clara tilted her head thoughtfully. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs funny how quickly things can change.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded. ‚ÄúSometimes, all it takes is one unexpected moment.‚Äù  

They exchanged a glance, something unspoken passing between them‚Äîa quiet acknowledgment that, for however brief a time, this moment was theirs.

### The End of a Moment  

The conversation had taken on a life of its own, meandering from lighthearted jokes to shared musings on life, creativity, and the strange unpredictability of human connection. Ethan and Clara had laughed more than either of them expected, their initial silence now a distant memory. The caf√©, once quiet and unassuming, had become the backdrop of something unexpectedly meaningful.  

Clara glanced at her watch and let out a soft sigh. ‚ÄúI hate to say it, but I should probably get going,‚Äù she admitted. ‚ÄúI have a deadline I can‚Äôt afford to miss.‚Äù  

Ethan nodded, though he felt a flicker of disappointment. ‚ÄúI know the feeling,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe real world has a way of interrupting the best conversations.‚Äù  

Clara smiled, pushing her chair back as she stood. ‚ÄúWell, I guess this was the chair‚Äôs way of forcing us to talk.‚Äù She gestured toward the overturned seat still lying on the pavement.  

Ethan chuckled, rising to his feet. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll have to thank it for its dramatic flair.‚Äù He hesitated for a moment before adding, ‚ÄúIt was really nice talking to you.‚Äù  

Clara met his gaze, her expression warm. ‚ÄúSame here.‚Äù  

For a brief moment, they simply stood there, the weight of the past half-hour settling between them. Then, with a final smile, Clara turned and walked away, disappearing into the quiet streets.  

Ethan watched her go, then glanced at the chair one last time. He shook his head, smiling to himself as he stepped forward to right it. Some moments, he thought, were meant to be fleeting‚Äîbut that didn‚Äôt make them any less real.

### Oblaƒçen in dolgoƒçasen dan  

Nebo je bilo te≈æko sivo, kot da se spu≈°ƒça na svet in zadr≈æuje vsakr≈°en kanƒçek ≈æivahnosti. Oblaki so viseli nizko, debeli in negibni, ki so mesto obarvali v ugaslo, oprano luƒç. Zrak je bil hladen in tih, brez obiƒçajnega vetra, ki bi lahko ponudil nekaj olaj≈°anja ali gibanja. Tudi ulice, po navadi obljudene s hitrimi koraki in obƒçasnim ƒçebljanjem mimoidoƒçih, so bile srhljivo tihe. Obƒçasno se je kak≈°en avtomobil zapeljal mimo, gume ≈°epetajoƒç po vla≈ænem cesti≈°ƒçu, sicer pa se je zdel svet kot v zadr≈æevanju diha.  

V majhni kavarni na prostem, stisnjeni med dve obrabljeni stavbi, sta sedli dve figuri za mizo iz obledelega lesa, njuna parajoƒça skodelica kave sta bili edini znaki ≈æivljenja. Kavarna sama je bila skromna ‚Äì nekaj miz je bilo raztresenih pod obledelo nadstre≈°nico, barva je obƒçutno odpadala na robovih. Nekaj praznih stolov je brezdelno sedelo naokrog, njihova prisotnost tiho priƒçanstvo pomanjkanja obiskovalcev.  

Dve osebi, sedi v ti≈°ini, njeni pogledi obƒçasno ≈°vigajo eden proti drugemu, vendar nikoli ne vztrajajo. Mo≈°ki, obleƒçen v temno jakno in kavbojke, je sklanjal rahlo naprej, prsti so objemali toplo skodelico, kot da bi iz nje ƒçrpal tola≈æbo. ≈Ωenska na drugi strani je nosila mehko modro majico, lase je imela spete v nizko figo. Nihƒçe ni spregovoril, njuni izrazi neberljivi, njuna prisotnost v kavarni se je zdela nenamerna.  

Nad njimi so oblaki ostali nepremiƒçni, kot da jim je vseeno za tihi trenutek, ki se odvija spodaj.  

### Tiho sreƒçanje  

Mo≈°ki, ki se mu je reklo Ethan, je v kavarno pri≈°el iskat samoto. Po poklicu pisec, a zadnje ƒçase ga je muza izneverila. Oblaƒçno vreme je zrcalilo njegovo razpolo≈æenje ‚Äì brezvoljno, brez navdiha, obremenjeno z nedokonƒçanimi idejami. Upal je, da mu bo sprememba scene prebudila nekaj, vendar je zaenkrat para newhala samo para iz njegove kave. Pogledal je ≈æensko na drugi strani mize, opazil naƒçin, kako absorbirano je s prstom drsela po robu skodelice, njen pogled usmerjen na nekak≈°no oddaljeno toƒçko preko kavarne. Zdela se mu je enako izgubljena v mislih kot je bil sam.  

≈Ωenska, ki se je imenovala Clara, se ni nameravala v kavarni zadr≈æati dolgo. Vstopila je na hitro, potrebovala je kratek beg iz monotonosti dnevne rutine. Grafiƒçna oblikovalka po poklicu, je Clara dopoldne pre≈æivela v kopici e-mailov in popravkov, njen um ≈æe izmuƒçen, preden je dan zares stal. Kavarna se ji je zdela kot zatoƒçi≈°ƒçe, kraj, kjer bo zbrala svoje misli ob topli pijaƒçi.  

Toda sedaj je sedela nasproti neznanca, ki je izgledal prav tako zaposlen kot se je poƒçutila sama, in kar naenkrat se je zavedla, kako nenavadno se poƒçuti v tej ti≈°ini med njima.  

Nobeden od njiju ni spregovoril, a vseeno se je nekaj med njunim stanjem zdelo nenavadno znano, kot bi bili liki v zgodbi, ki ƒçakata na zaƒçetek zapleta. Svet okrog njiju je ostajal tih, edini zvok je bilo obƒçasno ≈°umenje vej v daljavi. Ne Ethan ne Clara si nista ≈æelela oditi, ƒçeprav si tega nista znala razlo≈æiti. Bilo je, kot da bi bili med njima ≈æe nevidne vezi, vtkane v ti≈°ini.  

### Nepriƒçakovana prekinitev  

Ti≈°ino bi mogoƒçe lahko prena≈°ala v nedogled, ƒçe je ne bi nenadoma prekinil oster klopot stola, ki se je odbil proti tlom. Sunkov veter, nepriƒçakovan v svoji moƒçi, je pograbil prazen stol ob Clari in ga poslal nazaj, z nekim treskom. Zvok je prerezal ti≈°ino kot napaƒçna nota v simfoniji, ki je tako Ethana kot Claro iztrgal iz misli.  

Ethanovi glavo se je obrnila proti hrupu, njegove obrvi se zgrbile skupaj, ko je opazoval, kako stol drsi nazaj proti bli≈ænji mizi. Clara, preseneƒçena, je zaka≈°ljala in instinktivno potegnila noge nazaj, kot bi se stol lahko zakotalil proti njej. Za trenutek sta oba samo strmela in se zavedala absurdnosti situacije. Nato sta skoraj istoƒçasno pogledala drug drugega.  

Ethanovi kotiƒçki ust so se oklevali smeha, preden so ga lahko ustavili. "No," je rekel, njegov glas nizek in malo hrapav od neuporabe.  

Clarine obrvi so se dvignile, preseneƒçena nad nenadnim premorom v njuni skupni ti≈°ini. "Moram priznati," je odgovorila, njen glas svetlej≈°i kot je priƒçakovala. "To je bilo zelo dramatiƒçno."  

Trenutek se je premaknil. Kar je bilo dogovorjeno, da bo ostalo v njunih mislih, se je spremenilo v nekaj drugega ‚Äì radovednost, morda, ali preprosto olaj≈°anje, da nista povsem sama v ti≈°ini.  

Ethan je pogledal proti tlom, kjer je ≈°tor vse ≈°e vedno le≈æal, obrv pa dvignil vi≈°e. "Ali naj nekaj storiva glede tega, ali bo le ostal, kot da si je lastnin kavarno?"  

Clara je prikimala, razmi≈°ljajoƒç. "Mislim, da si je slu≈æil pravico, da ostane tam, kjer je."  

Smehek mu je zorekel v grlu in prviƒç, odkar je sedel, je ƒçutil premik ‚Äì nekaj, kar je ƒçuilo na zaƒçetek pogovora.  

### Pogovor se zaƒçne  

Ethan se je naslonil nazaj na svoj stol, ne≈æen nasme≈°ek ≈°e vedno na njegovem obrazu. "No, ƒçe stol slu≈æi tako, potem ga je treba spo≈°tovati," je rekel, njegov glas nosoƒç trasa resnosti.  

Clara se je zasmejala, smeh toplej≈°i kot nepriƒçakovan v tihi kavarni. "Absolutno," se je strinjala. "Oƒçitno je to stol z velikim dramskim talentom."  

Absurdnost njune izmenjave bi morala se zdeti prisiljena, vendar je vsakdo potekal naravno, kot dolgo pozabljena melodija, ki se konƒçno spet predvaja. Ethan je pogledal proti svoji skodelici kave. "Torej, ali pogosto prihajate sem, ali ste tako preseneƒçeni, kot sem jaz, da smo konƒçali v tem majhnem kotiƒç ku sveta?"  

Clara je premi≈°ljala, poigrala je prste proti toplemu keramiƒçnemu vrhu svoje skodelice. "ƒåisto odkrito?" priznala je. "Ponavadi ne zahajam v tak≈°ne kraje. Samo posku≈°ala sem si zbistriti glavo, in ta kavarna je izgledala kot dobro mesto za to." Sne≈æno pogledala je okoli sebe, proti praznim mizam, proti raztre≈°ƒçenim ostankom stola, ki ga je veter pustil tam, kjer je stal.  

"Niti nisem priƒçakovala dru≈æbe."  

Ethan je ƒçmoliko prikimal. "Enako, tudi jaz. Upal sem na nekaj navdiha, a namesto tega sem dobil zelo dramatiƒçno predstavo stola." Naredil je po≈æirek kave, preden je dodal: "ƒåeprav moram priznati, da se to izka≈æe za bolj zanimivo, kot sem priƒçakoval."  

Clara je nasmehnila s kotiƒçki ustnic. "Kaj pa vi? Kaj poƒçnete?"  

Ethan je dvignil obrv. "Je tako oƒçitno?"  

Clara je skomignila. "Imate tak≈°en izgled, kot da posku≈°ate ugotoviti, kako bi trenutek spremenili v zgodbo."  

On je nasmehnil. "Kriva priznanja." Oxhesitil je za trenutek, preden je dodal: "Kaj pa vi? Kaj poƒçenjate?"  

Clara je svoje ustnice naqognila navzgor. "Sem grafiƒçna oblikovalka. Veƒçino mojega ƒçasa pre≈æivim v barvah in pisavah, namesto v besedah."  

Ethan je prikimal, intregiran. "Torej, krasne stvari delate, medtem ko se jaz muƒçim, da bi ƒçrke sestavil v smisel."  

Clara se je nasmehnila nazaj. "Zveni kot po≈°tena izmenjava."  

In tako na lepem je pogovor stekel, lahkotno in nepremi≈°ljeno, kot da bi se ≈æe dolgo poznala.  

### Skupen trenutek  

Pogovor je stekel lahkoto, preplet med lahko-srƒçnimi opa≈ækanji in globljimi razmisleki. Ethan se je sklonil naprej, prsti njegovih rok pa so bobnali po mizi, ko je spregovoril. "Najhuj del biti pisatelj je, da zaƒçne≈° videti zgodbe povsod," je priznal. "Celo takrat, ko stol pade, postane potencialni preobrat zgodbe."  

Clara se je be≈æno nasmehnila, zmajevala z glavo. "To mora biti izƒçrpavajoƒçe."  

"Je," je potrdil z nasmehom. "A je tudi neizmerno. Vƒçasih najbolj vsakdanji trenutki postajajo nekaj nepriƒçakovanega." On je pomakanil na tla, kjer je stol le≈æal, in gestikuliral, "Kot ta stol, ki se odloƒçi za dramatiƒçni pobeg."  

Clarine oƒçi so zaprasketale v zabavi. "Mogoƒçe je sku≈°al dati izjavo o monotoniji kavarinskega ≈æivljenja."  

Ethan se je zasmejal, prikimal. "Toƒçno. Zahteval je veƒç vzburjenja, in zdaj poglejte ga ‚Äì le≈æi na sredini ploƒçnika, kot da je ravnokar konƒçal Shakespearov monolog."  

Clara se je ne≈æno zasmejala, zmajevala z glavo. "Vi res vidite zgodbe povsod."  

Ethan se je nasmehnil. "To je prekletosat pisatelja." Naredil je po≈æirek kave, preden je dodal: "A mislim, da je pravi ƒçude≈æ, da sploh komunicirava."  

Izmenjala sta si pogled, nekaj neizreƒçenega je pretekalo med njima ‚Äì tiho spoznanje, da je za kratek ƒças bil trenutek njun.HEMIA#Romanopsis trert',' type = 'italic'},

messages_a.content:
Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
In **Snowflake's web interface (Snowsight)**, when you're browsing or searching for database objects (like tables, views, schemas, etc.), the default search behavior is to look for objects **"starting with"** the text you type in the search bar.

If you want to search for objects that **"end with"** specific words or phrases (e.g., find all tables ending with `_STG`, `_HIST`, etc.), you can use **wildcards** or **SQL queries** since Snowsight does not provide a built-in "ends with" search option in its UI.

---

### ‚úÖ **Option 1: Use Wildcard Search in Snowsight**

Snowflake supports using the **underscore `_`** and **percent `%`** wildcards in the search bar.

To search for objects **ending with** a specific pattern:

1. Go to the **"Data"** section in Snowsight.
2. Navigate to the database/schema where you want to search.
3. In the search bar, type:
   ```
   %your_search_term
   ```

#### üîç Example:
To find all tables ending with `STG`, type:
```
%STG
```

This will return all objects whose names end with `STG`.

---

### ‚úÖ **Option 2: Query Snowflake Information Schema or SHOW Commands**

If the UI search isn't sufficient, you can use SQL to search for objects that end with specific text.

#### üîç Example: Find tables ending with `_STG`
```sql
SELECT TABLE_NAME
FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES
WHERE TABLE_NAME LIKE '%_STG';
```

#### üîç Example: Find views ending with `_HIST`
```sql
SHOW VIEWS LIKE '%_HIST';
```

You can also filter by schema or database:
```sql
SHOW VIEWS IN SCHEMA your_database.your_schema LIKE '%_HIST';
```

---

### ‚úÖ **Option 3: Use `DESCRIBE SCHEMA` or `SHOW` Commands**

You can combine `SHOW` commands with `LIKE` to filter objects ending with certain strings.

```sql
SHOW TABLES LIKE '%_ARCHIVE';
```

---

### Summary Table

| Method | Search Ends With | Syntax Example |
|-------|------------------|----------------|
| Snowsight UI Search | ‚úÖ | `%your_text` |
| SQL `LIKE` | ‚úÖ | `LIKE '%your_text'` |
| `SHOW` Command | ‚úÖ | `SHOW ... LIKE '%your_text'` |

---

Let me know if you want to search for specific object types (e.g., only views, only procedures), and I can give you tailored queries.

V Snowflakovem spletnem vmesniku (Snowsight) pri brskanju ali iskanju podatkovnih predmetov (kot so tabele, pogledi, sheme itd.) je privzeto iskanje nastavljeno tako, da poi≈°ƒçe predmete, ki **se zaƒçnejo z** besedilom, ki ga vnesete v vrstico za iskanje.

ƒåe ≈æelite poiskati predmete, ki **se konƒçajo z** doloƒçenimi besedami ali besednimi zvezami (npr. najdite vse tabele, ki se konƒçajo z `_STG`, `_HIST` itd.), lahko uporabite **znake za nadomestna imena** ali **SQL poizvedbe**, saj Snowsight v svojem vmesniku nima vgrajene mo≈ænosti iskanja "se konƒça z".

---

### ‚úÖ **1. mo≈ænost: Uporaba iskanja z nadomestnimi imeni v Snowsight**

Snowflake podpira uporabo **podƒçrtaj `_`** in **odstotek `%`** nadomestnih imen v vrstici za iskanje.

ƒåe ≈æelite poiskati predmete, ki **se konƒçajo s** doloƒçenim vzorcem:

1. Pojdite v razdelek **"Podatki"** v Snowsight.
2. Poi≈°ƒçite podatkovno zbirko/shemo, kjer ≈æelite iskati.
3. V vrstici za iskanje vnesite:
   ```
   %your_search_term
   ```

#### üîç **Primer:**
ƒåe ≈æelite najti vse tabele, ki se konƒçajo z `STG`, vnesite:
```
%STG
```

To bo vrnilo vse predmete, katerih imena se konƒçajo s `STG`.

---

### ‚úÖ **2. mo≈ænost: Poizvedbe informacijske sheme Snowflake ali ukazi SHOW**

ƒåe vmesnik za iskanje ni zadosten, lahko uporabite SQL za iskanje predmetov, ki se konƒçajo s specifiƒçnim besedilom.

#### üîç **Primer: Najdi tabele, ki se konƒçajo z `_STG`**
```sql
SELECT TABLE_NAME
FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES
WHERE TABLE_NAME LIKE '%_STG';
```

#### üîç **Primer: Najdi poglede, ki se konƒçajo z `_HIST`**
```sql
SHOW VIEWS LIKE '%_HIST';
```

Lahko tudi filtrirate po shemi ali podatkovni zbirki:
```sql
SHOW VIEWS IN SCHEMA your_database.your_schema LIKE '%_HIST';
```

---

### ‚úÖ **3. mo≈ænost: Uporaba ukazov `DESCRIBE SCHEMA` ali `SHOW`**

Ukaze `SHOW` lahko zdru≈æite z `LIKE`, da filtrirate predmete, ki se konƒçajo z doloƒçenimi nizom.

```sql
SHOW TABLES LIKE '%_ARCHIVE';
```

---

### Preglednica metod

| Metoda | Iskanje se konƒça z | Primer sintakse |
|-------|------------------|----------------|
| Iskanje vmesnika Snowsight | ‚úÖ | `%your_text` |
| SQL `LIKE` | ‚úÖ | `LIKE '%your_text'` |
| Ukaz `SHOW` | ‚úÖ | `SHOW ... LIKE '%your_text'` |

---

Sporoƒçite, ƒçe ≈æelite iskati doloƒçene tipe predmetov (npr. samo poglede, samo postopke) in lahko vam podam prilagojene poizvedbe.

Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
The correct term for a person you list on your CV who can be contacted for a reference is:

**"Referee"** (common in the UK, Australia, and other countries outside the US)  
or  
**"Reference"** (commonly used in the US).

Both terms are correct and often used interchangeably, though **"referee"** is more precise when referring to the person, while **"reference"** can sometimes refer to the information itself (contact details and statement).

### Example CV Entry:
**Referees / References:**
- Available upon request.

You typically don't list their contact details on the CV itself unless specifically requested. Instead, you provide a separate **reference list** when asked.

### Summary:
- **Referee** = the person who provides a reference.
- **Reference** = the recommendation or the person (depending on context).
- In most modern CVs, you simply write: *"Available upon request."*

Let me know if you'd like a sample reference list format!

Pravilen izraz za osebo, ki jo navedete v svojem ≈æivljenjepisu in jo lahko kontaktirate za priporoƒçilo, je:

**"Referee"** (pogosteje uporabljeno v ZK, Avstraliji in drugih dr≈æavah zunaj ZDA)  
ali  
**"Reference"** (pogosteje uporabljeno v ZDA).

Obe imeni sta pravilni in se pogosto uporabljata izmeniƒçno, ƒçeprav je **"Referee"** bolj natanƒçen izraz za osebo, medtem ko se **"Reference"** lahko vƒçasih nana≈°a tudi na samo informacijo (kontaktni podatki in izjava).

### Primer vnosa v ≈æivljenjepis:
**Referenci:**
- Na voljo na zahtevo.

Navadno ne navajate njihovih kontaktnih podatkov v ≈æivljenjepisu, razen ƒçe ni izrecno zahtevano. Namesto tega boste na zahtevo predlo≈æili loƒçen seznam referenc.

### Povzetek:
- **Referee** = oseba, ki daje priporoƒçilo.
- **Reference** = priporoƒçilo ali oseba (odvisno od konteksta).
- V veƒçini sodobnih ≈æivljenjepisov preprosto napi≈°ete: *"Na voljo na zahtevo."*

Sporoƒçite mi, ƒçe ≈æelite vzorec formata seznama referenc!
Chosen: gams_9b_sft_translator

I am trying to filter the Firefox browser version with netskope.

For that i use the http header. According to default regex a expression like

/.* Firefox\/[1-9][0-9]{2,}\.([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]{1,2}).*$/gm should work to match the version header of firefox that goes like this : Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/111.0

messages_a.content:
Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
**Title: *The Path of the Silent Flame***

---

### **Prologue: The Whisper in the Pines**

They found him in the forest where the wind never slept.

Wrapped in a tattered red shawl, the child lay curled beneath the roots of an ancient cedar, the snow brushing his pale cheeks like a mother‚Äôs kiss. He could not have been more than four. His eyes, wide and dark as ink, stared up at the storm with a quiet defiance that would one day become legend.

The monks of the Temple of the Silent Flame had come to forage for herbs in the winter woods. They were not supposed to stray so far from the mountain path, but the old monk, Master Jin-Rho, had insisted. He claimed the forest was calling.

And so it was that the child, nameless and barefoot, was carried down from the snow-capped woods and into a life of discipline, silence, and fire.

---

### **Part I: The Boy Without a Name**

He had no name when he arrived at the temple. In the tradition of the Silent Flame, he was given a title instead: *Kael*, meaning ‚Äúthe one who walks alone.‚Äù

Master Jin-Rho, a man whose body was as weathered as the mountains and whose spirit was as sharp as a katana‚Äôs edge, took the boy under his wing. He had once been a warrior in the imperial guard, a master of the lost art of *Shen Wu* ‚Äî the Way of the Whispering Fist, a martial discipline so subtle it was said to be invisible to the untrained eye.

Kael trained from dawn until dusk, and often into the night. He learned to move like water, to strike like thunder, and to listen to the silence between heartbeats. But more than that, he learned philosophy, medicine, poetry, and the art of stillness. Jin-Rho believed that a true warrior was not forged in violence, but in balance.

‚ÄúYou are not here to destroy,‚Äù Jin-Rho would say, ‚Äúbut to protect. And to find yourself.‚Äù

Yet Kael never forgot the forest. He remembered the red shawl, the scent of jasmine that clung to it, and the melody his mother had once sung ‚Äî a song of fireflies and forgotten stars.

---

### **Part II: The Awakening**

By the time Kael was sixteen, he had surpassed all the other disciples. He could run across water, break stone with a whisper, and sense a heartbeat from a hundred paces. But his greatest skill was in silence ‚Äî not just of movement, but of mind.

One night, Jin-Rho summoned him to the temple‚Äôs inner sanctum. There, he revealed a scroll ‚Äî old, brittle, and sealed with the sigil of the Red Lotus, a symbol of a long-buried rebellion.

‚ÄúYour mother was not just any woman,‚Äù Jin-Rho said. ‚ÄúShe was a healer, a spy, and a rebel. She came to me when you were born, begging me to protect you. She said a man known as *The Ashen King* had taken her soul ‚Äî not in death, but in chains. He rules the opium dens of the south with a fist of fire and poison.‚Äù

Kael‚Äôs heart burned with a new fire. He had trained for years to master himself, but now he had a purpose beyond the temple walls.

‚ÄúI will find her,‚Äù he said, voice steady as stone.

Jin-Rho nodded. ‚ÄúThen go. But know this: the path you walk is not one of vengeance. It is one of truth. Bring her back, yes. But bring yourself back too.‚Äù

---

### **Part III: The Ashen King**

Kael descended from the mountains like a shadow, his red shawl now a sash across his chest. He traveled through cities choked with smoke and villages hollowed by addiction. He saw the faces of those broken by the Ashen King‚Äôs empire ‚Äî children with glassy eyes, mothers with empty arms, men who had forgotten their own names.

Each night, he trained. Each day, he searched. He infiltrated the King‚Äôs strongholds, learning the layout of his world ‚Äî the hidden tunnels beneath the opium dens, the secret gardens where the poppies bloomed black, and the prison beneath the palace where the King kept his most dangerous prisoners.

And then, one night, he heard it ‚Äî the melody.

The same lullaby his mother had sung to him in the forest.

He followed it through the catacombs, past guards who never saw him, past traps he disarmed with a breath. And there, in a cell of iron and ash, he found her.

She was thinner, her hair streaked with white, but her eyes still burned with the same fire he had inherited.

‚ÄúYou came back,‚Äù she whispered.

‚ÄúI never left,‚Äù he said.

---

### **Epilogue: The Flame That Binds**

Kael did not kill the Ashen King. He broke his empire piece by piece, from within. He freed the prisoners, burned the poppy fields, and scattered the King‚Äôs lieutenants like dust in the wind.

But the greatest victory was not in the fall of the King ‚Äî it was in the rekindling of a bond thought lost to time.

Kael and his mother returned to the mountains, to the Temple of the Silent Flame. There, she helped heal the sick, and he taught the new disciples.

Master Jin-Rho watched them from the steps of the temple, a quiet smile on his lips.

The boy who walked alone had found his path.

And in the silence between heartbeats, the flame still burned.

--- 

**End.**

**Naslov: *Pot tihe plamene***

---

### **Prolog: ≈†epet v borovcih**

Najdeno ga je v gozdu, kjer veter ni nikoli poƒçival.

Odet v raztrgano rdeƒço ruto je otrok le≈æal skljuƒçen pod koreninami starega cedre, sneg pa je bo≈æal njegove blede lica kot materin poljub. Ne bi mogel biti starej≈°i od ≈°tirih let. Njegove oƒçi, ≈°iroke in temne kot ƒçrnilo, so z mirnim izzivom, ki bo nekoƒç postal legenda, strmele v vihar.

Menihi Templja tihega ognja so pri≈°li v zimske gozdove nabirat zeli≈°ƒça. Niso se smeli oddaljiti od gorske poti, vendar je star menih, mojster Jin-Rho, vztrajal. Trdil je, da ga gozd kliƒçe.

In tako so otroka, brez imena in bosega, prinesli iz gozda, prekritega s snegom, in ga vkljuƒçili v ≈æivljenje discipline, ti≈°ine in ognja.

---

### **1. del: Deƒçek brez imena**

Ko je prispel v tempelj, ni imel imena. V tradiciji tihega ognja so mu namesto tega dali naziv: *Kael*, kar pomeni ¬ªtisti, ki hodi sam¬´.

Mojster Jin-Rho, ƒçlovek, ƒçigar telo je bilo tako utrujeno kot gore, duh pa oster kot rob katane, je mladeniƒça vzel pod svoje okrilje. Bil je nekdaj vojak v cesarski stra≈æi, mojster izgubljene umetnosti *Shen Wu* ‚Äì poti ≈°epetanja pesti, marcialne discipline, ki je bila tako subtilna, da je bila nevidna za neizurjeno oko.

Kael je treniral od zore do mraka in vƒçasih ≈°e v noƒç. Nauƒçil se je, kako se premikati kot voda, udariti kot grom in poslu≈°ati ti≈°ino med utripi srca. Toda ≈°e veƒç kot to, nauƒçil se je filozofije, medicine, poezije in umetnosti mirovanja. Jin-Rho je verjel, da pravi bojevnik ni kovan z nasiljem, temveƒç z ravnovesjem.

¬ªTukaj nisi zato, da bi uniƒçeval,¬´ je rekel Jin-Rho, ¬ªtemveƒç da bi varoval in na≈°el samega sebe.¬´

Kljub temu Kael ni nikoli pozabil gozda. Spominjal se je rdeƒçe rute, vonja jasmina, ki se je dr≈æal nanjo, in napeva, ki ga je nekoƒç pela njegova mati ‚Äì pesem o kresnicah in pozabljenih zvezdah.

---

### **2. del: Prebujanje**

Ko je bil Kael star ≈°estnajst let, je presegel vse druge uƒçence. Lahko je tekel po vodi, razbijal kamen z zadihom in ƒçutil utrip srca od sto korakov daleƒç. Njegova najveƒçja spretnost pa je bila ti≈°ina ‚Äì ne le gibanja, ampak tudi uma.

Neke noƒçi ga je Jin-Rho poklical v notranjo sveti≈°ƒçe templja. Tam je razkril zvitek ‚Äì starega, krhkega, zapeƒçatenega s simbolom rdeƒçega lokvanja, ki je bil znak dolgo zakopanega upora.

¬ªTvoja mati ni bila navadna ≈æenska,¬´ je rekel Jin-Rho. ¬ªBila je zdravilka, vohunka in upornica. K meni je pri≈°la, ko si se rodil, in me rotila, naj te za≈°ƒçitim. Rekla je, da je njen du≈°o vzel mo≈æ, imenovan *Pepelnati kralj* ‚Äì ne v smrti, temveƒç v okovih. S pestjo ognja in strupa vlada opijskim razvalinam na jugu.¬´

Kaelovo srce je gorelo z novim ognjem. Veƒç let se je treniral, da bi obvladal samega sebe, zdaj pa je imel namen, ki je presegal tempeljske zidove.

¬ªPoiskal jo bom,¬´ je rekel, njegov glas trden kot kamen.

Jin-Rho je prikimal. ¬ªPotem pojdi. Toda vedi to: pot, po kateri hodi≈°, ni pot ma≈°ƒçevanja. Je pot resnice. Prinesi jo nazaj, ja. Toda prinesi nazaj tudi sebe.¬´

---

### **3. del: Pepelnati kralj**

Kael je s hribov sestopil kot senca, njegova rdeƒça ruta pa je bila zdaj trak ƒçez prsi. Potoval je skozi mesta, zadu≈°ena z dimom, in vasi, izdolbene zaradi odvisnosti. Videl je obraze tistih, ki jih je razbil imperij Pepelnatega kralja ‚Äì otroke s steklenimi oƒçmi, matere z izpraznjenimi rokami, mo≈°ke, ki so pozabili lastna imena.

Vsako noƒç se je treniral. Vsak dan je iskal. Vtihotapil se je v kraljeve utrdbe in se nauƒçil ureditve njegovega sveta ‚Äì skritih tunelov pod opijskimi razvalinami, skrivnih vrtov, kjer so se makove glave cvetele ƒçrno, in jeƒçe pod palaƒço, v kateri je Kralj zadr≈æeval svoje najnevarnej≈°e zapornike.

In nekega veƒçera je zasli≈°al melodijo.

Isto uspavanko, ki mu jo je v gozdu pela mati.

Sledila mu je skozi katakombe, mimo stra≈æarjev, ki ga niso videli, mimo pasti, ki jih je razoro≈æil z dahom. In tam, v celici iz ≈æeleza in pepela, jo je na≈°el.

Bila je bolj suha, njene lase so prepletali beli prameni, a njene oƒçi so ≈°e vedno gorele z istim ognjem, ki ga je podedoval.

¬ªVrnil si se,¬´ je za≈°epetala.

¬ªNikoli nisem od≈°el,¬´ je rekel.

---

### **Epilog: Plamen, ki ve≈æe**

Kael Pepelnatega kralja ni ubil. Svoje cesarstvo je razbil po delih, od znotraj. Oslobodil je zapornike, se≈ægal makove nasade in kraljeve poveljnike raztre≈°ƒçil kot prah v vetru.

Toda najveƒçja zmaga ni bila v padcu Kralja ‚Äì bila je v ponovnem v≈æigu vezi, ki jo je ƒças ≈æe skoraj pozabil.

Kael in njegova mati sta se vrnila v gore, v Tempelj tihega ognja. Tam ji je pomagala zdraviti bolnike, on pa je uƒçil nove uƒçence.

Mojster Jin-Rho ju je opazoval s stopnic templja, na ustnicah pa mu je visel tih nasmeh.

Deƒçek, ki je hodil sam, je na≈°el svojo pot.

In v ti≈°ini med utripi srca je plamen ≈°e vedno gorel.

---

Kljub vsemu ostaja v Kaelu spomin na gozd. Spominja se rdeƒçe ≈°ale, vonja jasmina, ki se mu je prilepil in pesmi mame, ki je govorila o kresnicah in pozabljenih zvezdah.
 
---

### **2. del: prebujanje**

Do sedmega leta je Kael presegel vse druge vajence. Lahko bi prehodil vodo, podrl kamen s ≈°epetanim besedam, ƒçutil bilj srca metrov stran. Njegova najveƒçja vrlina pa je bila v tem, kako je obvladal ti≈°ino - ne le v gibanju, ampak v misli.

Nekega dne ga je Jin-Rho poklical staro do samih ter mu v roke predal zvitku, ki je bil star in krhek ter opremljen grbom Rdeƒçega lotosa, simbol zamolƒçanega upora.

"Tvoja mama ni bila preprosta ≈æenska," je rekel Jin-Rho. "Bila je zdraviteljica, vohunka in upornik. Ob ¬ªrojstvu¬´ ti je nastavila nalogo, da jo moram za≈°ƒçititi. Povedala mi je, o mo≈æu, znanem kot "prekleti kralj", ki ji je vzel du≈°o, welke je ni ubil, tem veƒç zaprl v verige. Vlada dvoru z ognjeno pestijo in uporablja strup."
 
Kaelova du≈°a je zagorela v novem plamene. Treniral je vse ≈æivljenje, da bi samega sebe obvladal, vendar je zdaj dobil namen izven templja.

"Povodim jo nazaj," je rekel z glasom, trdnim kot kamen.
 
Jin-Rho prikimal. "Pojdi, a pomni: tvoja pot ni pot ma≈°ƒçevanja. To je pot resnice. Prinesi jo nazaj, pripelji pa tudi sebe."

---

### **3. del: preklet pekralj**

Kael se je vrhu gora spustil kot senca s svojo rdeƒço ≈°alo, zdaj kot pas, zavezan preko prsi. Potoval je skozi mesta, ki so bila zadahana od dima, in skozi vasi, ki so vzniknile od odvisnosti. Videl je obraze ljudi. ki jih je kralj s svojim imperijem strl - otroki, ki so prodirali skozi steklen pogled; matere, ki so imele prazne roke; mo≈°ke, ki so pozabili celo svoje ime.

Vsak veƒçer je treniral, vsak dan pa je iskal. Infiltriral se je v kraljeve trdnjavne in spoznal kraljevi svet v ≈æivo. Skrivalne hodnike pod la≈æirnimi dolinami, skrite vrtove, kde so poginjele poppie, in zapor, kjer je kralj zadr≈æal svoje najbolj nevarne zaporuje.

Neke noƒçi je zasli≈°al to - melodijo.

Isti skupni kovaƒç kot mama v gozdu.

Led ga je prepriƒçal preko katakombe, mimo stra≈æ, ki je niso vidle in past, ki je ni sli≈°ala. In tam v ≈æelezni in pepelni celici je na≈°el svojo mamo.
Bile so bolj shilijo kot je mislil in njeni lasje bolj beli, vendar je njen poegled ostal enak sonprej.

"Vrnil si se," je za≈°epetala.

"Nikoli ti nisem u≈°el," je odgovoril.

---

### **Epilog: Plamenska vez** 

Kael ni ubil prekleti kralj. Svoj imperij je razbil poƒçasi iz znotraj. Osvobodil je zaporujuke, za≈ægala rastline rastlin in raztresel kraljuve poveljnike.

Najveƒçja zmaga ni bila v padcu prekleti kralj - to je bilo ponovno stkanje vezi.

Kael in njegova mati sta se vrnila v gore, v tempelj plameneƒçe ti≈°ine. Tam je pomagala zdraviti bolne in on je pouƒçeval nove vajence.
 
Mojster Jin-Rho ju je opazoval z vrha templja - tsmi„Çí„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã opportunit√† sottilissimo, pre.

Deƒçek, ki je hodil sam, je na≈°el svojo pot.

In ti≈°ina med bitjem srca ≈°e vedno gori.

messages_a.content:
Prevedi naslednje besedilo v sloven≈°ƒçino.
Absolutely! Color grading and editing a moody, horror-themed render in **DaVinci Resolve** can dramatically enhance the atmosphere and tension of your Unreal Engine 5 (UE5) project. Since you're a beginner, I'll break this down into simple, step-by-step tips and explain the interface in a way that's easy to follow.

---

## üé¨ Overview of DaVinci Resolve Interface (Simplified)

DaVinci Resolve has **four main workspaces**:

1. **Media** ‚Äì Import your footage.
2. **Edit** ‚Äì Basic editing (we'll skip this for now).
3. **Color** ‚Äì Where we‚Äôll do all the color grading.
4. **Deliver** ‚Äì Export your final video.

We‚Äôll focus on the **Color** page for this guide.

---

## üß† Step-by-Step Tips for Moody, Horror-Themed Color Grading

### 1. **Import Your Render**
- Go to the **Media** page (far left icon).
- Click the **Import Media** button and select your UE5 render.
- Drag it to the timeline at the bottom.

### 2. **Navigate the Color Page**
- Click the **Color** tab at the bottom or top of the screen.
- You‚Äôll see:
  - **Nodes Panel (Left)** ‚Äì Where you apply color corrections.
  - **Inspector Panel (Right)** ‚Äì Adjusts selected node settings.
  - **Scopes (Top Right)** ‚Äì Tools to analyze your image (we‚Äôll come back to this).
  - **Timeline (Bottom)** ‚Äì Shows your clip.

---

### 3. **Basic Correction (Node 1) ‚Äì Fix Exposure and Contrast**
- Start with a **Primary Correction**:
  - Use the **Waveform**, **Parade**, and **Vectorscope** to analyze your image (optional for now).
  - Use the **Lift, Gamma, Gain** wheels:
    - **Lift** (shadows): Slightly raise red or blue to add a cold base.
    - **Gamma** (midtones): Lower green a bit to add eeriness.
    - **Gain** (highlights): Lower highlights to keep things dark and moody.
  - Add a **Power Window** (mask) to isolate areas like faces or lights if needed.

> üß™ Tip: Don‚Äôt overdo it here. This is just a base grade.

---

### 4. **Add a LUT (Node 2) ‚Äì Instant Horror Vibe**
- Right-click the node and choose **Add Node > Serial Node**.
- In the **Inspector**, under **LUT**, choose a horror-style LUT:
  - Try **Cinestyle** or **Rec.709** if none are scary enough.
  - You can also **import your own LUTs** (search for ‚Äúfree horror LUTs‚Äù online).
- Adjust **LUT Intensity** to blend it subtly with your base grade.

---

### 5. **Create Depth with Curves (Node 3)**
- Add another serial node.
- Go to the **Curves** tab in the Inspector.
  - **Luma Curve** (brightness): Create an S-curve to increase contrast.
  - **RGB Curves**: Add a slight blue or green lift in shadows, and red/orange in highlights for contrast.

> üß™ This adds depth and enhances the eerie mood.

---

### 6. **Add Fog or Mist with a Blur Node (Optional ‚Äì Node 4)**
- Add a **Parallel Node** (right-click > Add Node > Parallel Node).
- Use **Blur** in the **Qualifier** tab:
  - Mask out the foreground with a **Power Window**, leaving the background.
  - Apply a slight blur to simulate fog or distance haze.
- Lower the **opacity** so it blends naturally.

---

### 7. **Color Balance Shadows, Midtones, Highlights (Node 5)**
- Add a serial node.
- Use the **Color Balance** wheels:
  - **Shadows**: Add blue or green for cold, dark tones.
  - **Midtones**: Slightly desaturate or add green for sickly tones.
  - **Highlights**: Add red or orange for contrast and warmth in lights or blood.

---

### 8. **Add a Vignette (Node 6)**
- Add another serial node.
- Click the **Window** button and choose **Pipette** or **Shape**.
- Draw a circle around the center of the frame.
- Invert the mask so only the edges are affected.
- Use **Gain** to darken the edges.
- Lower the **opacity** to keep it subtle.

---

### 9. **Add Grain (Node 7 ‚Äì Final Touch)**
- Add a serial node.
- Go to **OpenFX** (top right).
- Search for **Grain** and add it.
- Adjust the amount to taste (don‚Äôt go too high).
- This adds texture and realism, perfect for horror.

---

## üé® Final Tips for a Horror Mood

- **Desaturation**: Slightly reduce overall saturation for a bleak look.
- **Cool Tones**: Use blues and greens in shadows.
- **Warm Highlights**: Reds or oranges in lights (e.g., candles, blood).
- **High Contrast**: Use S-curves in curves to punch up the mood.
- **Dark Blacks**: Crush blacks a bit for mystery (but don‚Äôt lose detail).
- **Flickering Lights?** Use **Power Windows** and **Tracking** to follow light sources and adjust color/exposure dynamically.

---

## üì§ Exporting Your Final Video (Deliver Page)

- Go to the **Deliver** tab.
- Choose your **Format** (MP4 or MOV is good for most uses).
- Set **Resolution** and **Frame Rate** to match your render.
- Click **Add Job** and then **Start Render**.

---

## üìö Beginner-Friendly Resources

- **DaVinci Resolve Tutorials on YouTube**:
  - [Peter McKinnon ‚Äì Color Grading Basics](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abc123)
  - [Color Grading Central ‚Äì Horror Looks](https://www.youtube.com/@ColorGradingCentral)
- **Free Horror LUTs**:
  - [Motion Array](https://www.motionarray.com/stock footage/luts/)
  - [Noir LUTs](https://noirlut.com/)

---

## üß© Bonus: Organize Your Nodes Visually

- Right-click nodes and rename them (e.g., ‚ÄúBase Grade‚Äù, ‚ÄúLUT‚Äù, ‚ÄúVignette‚Äù).
- Hold **Alt** and drag to connect nodes in different ways (advanced).
- Use **Node Graph** (top left) to see your flow.

---

If you want, I can give you a **preset node tree** or a **step-by-step project file** structure to follow. Just let me know!

Let me know what kind of horror vibe you're going for (e.g., slasher, supernatural, psychological) ‚Äì I can tailor the grade even more! üé•üñ§

Seveda! Barvno korekcijo in urejanje zlove≈°ƒçega, grozljivega prizora v programu **DaVinci Resolve** lahko moƒçno okrepi vzdu≈°je in napetost v va≈°em projektu v Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). Ker ste zaƒçetnik, bom to razbil na preproste, korak za korakom razumljive nasvete in pojasnil vmesnik na preprost naƒçin.

---

## üé¨ Preprosta predstavitev vmesnika v programu **DaVinci Resolve**

Program **DaVinci Resolve ima ≈°tiri glavna delovna obmoƒçja**:

1. **Media** ‚Äì Uvozite videoposnetek.
2. **Edit** ‚Äì Osnovno urejanje (za zdaj bomo to izpustili).
3. **Color** ‚Äì Tu bomo opravili vse barvne korekcije.
4. **Deliver** ‚Äì Izvozi konƒçni video.

Za ta vodiƒç se bomo osredotoƒçili na stran **Color**.

---

## üß† Korak za korakom do zlove≈°ƒçega, grozljivega videza

### 1. **Uvozi prizor**
- Pojdite na stran **Media** (ikona na skrajni levi).
- Kliknite gumb **Import Media** in izberite posnetek UE5.
- Povlecite ga na ƒçasovno ƒçrto na dnu.

### 2. **Premik po strani **Color**
- Kliknite kartico **Color** na dnu ali vrhu zaslona.
- Videli boste:
  - **Panel vozli≈°ƒç (levo)** ‚Äì tukaj boste opravili barvne korekcije.
  - **Inspector Panel (desno)** ‚Äì prilagajanje nastavitev izbranega vozli≈°ƒça.
  - **Scopes (desno zgoraj)** ‚Äì orodja za analizo slike (o tem bomo ≈°e govorili).
  - **ƒåasovna ƒçrta (spodaj)** ‚Äì prikazuje va≈° posnetek.

---

### 3. **Osnovna korekcija (vozli≈°ƒçe 1) ‚Äì popravite osvetlitev in kontrast**
- Zaƒçnite s **primarno korekcijo**:
  - Uporabite **Waveform**, **Parade** in **Vectorscope** za analizo slike (za zdaj to ni obvezno).
  - Uporabite kolesa **Lift, Gamma, Gain**:
    - **Lift** (sence): rahlo dvignite rdeƒço ali modro, da dodate hladno osnovo.
    - **Gamma** (vmesne tone): rahlo zni≈æajte zeleno, da dodate grozljivost.
    - **Gain** (izpostavljenost): zni≈æajte izpostavljenost, da ohranite temo in zlove≈°ƒçenost.
  - Dodajte **Power Window** (masko), da izolirate obmoƒçja, kot so obrazi ali luƒçi, ƒçe je potrebno.

> üß™ Nasvet: Tu ne pretiravajte. To je le osnovna korekcija.

---

### 4. **Dodajte LUT (vozli≈°ƒçe 2) ‚Äì takoj≈°nja grozljivka**
- Z desno mi≈°kino tipko kliknite vozli≈°ƒçe in izberite **Add Node > Serial Node**.
- V polju **Inspector**, pod **LUT**, izberite LUT v slogu grozljivke:
  - Poskusite z **Cinestyle** ali **Rec.709**, ƒçe noben izmed njih ni dovolj srhljiv.
  - Lahko tudi uvozite **svoje LUT-e** (poi≈°ƒçite jih prek spleta).
- Prilagodite **LUT Intensity**, da ga ne≈æno zme≈°ate z osnovno korekcijo.

---

### 5. **Ustvarite globino s krivuljami (vozli≈°ƒçe 3)**
- Dodajte ≈°e eno serijsko vozli≈°ƒçe.
- Pojdite na kartico **Curves** v polju Inspector.
  - **Luma Curve** (svetlost): ustvarite S-krivuljo za poveƒçanje kontrasta.
  - **RGB Curves**: dodajte rahlo modro ali zeleno v sencah in rdeƒço/oran≈æno v izpostavljenosti za kontrast.

> üß™ To doda globino in okrepi grozeƒç pridih.

---

### 6. **Dodajte meglico ali meglico z vozli≈°ƒçem za zameglitev (neobvezno ‚Äì vozli≈°ƒçe 4)**
- Dodajte **Parallel Node** (z desno mi≈°kino tipko kliknite > Add Node > Parallel Node).
- Uporabite **Blur** v polju **Qualifier**:
  - Z **Power Window** izloƒçite ospredje, tako da ostane ozadje.
  - Uporabite rahlo zameglitev, da simulirate meglico ali oddaljeno meglo.
- Zni≈æajte **opacity**, da se naravno zlije.

---

### 7. **Barvno uravnote≈æite sence, vmesne tone in izpostavljenost (vozli≈°ƒçe 5)**
- Dodajte serijsko vozli≈°ƒçe.
- Uporabite kolesa **Color Balance**:
  - **Shadows**: dodajte modro ali zeleno za hladne, temne tone.
  - **Midtones**: rahlo razbarvajte ali dodajte zeleno za slabotne tone.
  - **Highlights**: dodajte rdeƒço ali oran≈æno za kontrast in toploto v svetlobi ali krvi.

---

### 8. **Dodajte vignetno (vozli≈°ƒçe 6)**
- Dodajte ≈°e eno serijsko vozli≈°ƒçe.
- Kliknite gumb **Window** in izberite **Pipette** ali **Shape**.
- Nari≈°ite krog okoli sredi≈°ƒça slikovnega polja.
- Masko obrnite, tako da vpliva le na robove.
- Uporabite **Gain**, da potemnite robove.
- Zni≈æajte **opacity**, da ostane neopazno.

---

### 9. **Dodajte ≈°um (vozli≈°ƒçe 7 ‚Äì konƒçni dotik)**
- Dodajte serijsko vozli≈°ƒçe.
- Pojdite na **OpenFX** (zgoraj desno).
- Poi≈°ƒçite **Grain** in ga dodajte.
- Prilagodite koliƒçino po okusu (ne preveƒç).
- To doda teksturo in realnost, kar je popolno za grozljivke.

---

## üé® Konƒçni nasveti za grozljiv pridih

- **Desaturacija**: rahlo zmanj≈°ajte splo≈°no nasiƒçenost za bledikav videz.
- **Hladni toni**: uporabite modro in zeleno v senci.
- **Topla svetloba**: rdeƒça ali oran≈æna v svetlobi (npr. sveƒçe, kri).
- **Visok kontrast**: uporabite S-krivulje v krivuljah za poudarjanje vzdu≈°ja.
- **Temne ƒçrnine**: rahlo zmanj≈°ajte ƒçrnine za skrivnostnost (vendar ne izgubite podrobnosti).
- **Trzanje luƒçi?** Uporabite **Power Windows** in **Tracking**, da sledite virom svetlobe in dinamiƒçno prilagajate barvo/osvetlitev.

---

## üì§ Izvoz konƒçnega videoposnetka (stran **Deliver**)

- Pojdite na kartico **Deliver**.
- Izberite svoj **Format** (MP4 ali MOV je dober za veƒçino uporab).
- Nastavite **Resolution** in **Frame Rate**, da se ujema z va≈°im posnetkom.
- Kliknite **Add Job** in nato **Start Render**.

---

## üìö Viri, prijazni do zaƒçetnikov

- **Uƒçna gradiva o programu **DaVinci Resolve** na YouTubu**:
  - [Peter McKinnon ‚Äì Barvna korekcija osnov (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abc123)]
  - [Barvna korekcija Central ‚Äì Grozljive podobe (https://www.youtube.com/@ColorGradingCentral)]
- **Brezplaƒçni LUT-i za grozljivke**:
  - [Motion Array](https://www.motionarray.com/stock footage/luts/)
  - [Noir LUTs](https://noirlut.com/)

---

## üß© Dodatek: vizualno urejanje vozli≈°ƒç

- Z desno mi≈°kino tipko kliknite vozli≈°ƒça in jih preimenujte (npr. ¬ªOsnovna korekcija¬´, ¬ªLUT¬´, ¬ªVignetna¬´).
- Pritisnite **Alt** in povlecite, da vozli≈°ƒça pove≈æete na razliƒçne naƒçine (napredno).
- Uporabite **Node Graph** (zgoraj levo), da vidite potek.

---

ƒåe ≈æelite, vam lahko dam **prednastavljeno drevo vozli≈°ƒç** ali **strukturo projekta po korakih**, po kateri lahko sledite. Samo sporoƒçite mi!

Sporoƒçite mi, kak≈°en grozljiv pridih ≈æelite (npr. morilec, nadnaravno, psiholo≈°ko) ‚Äì lahko prilagodim korekcijo ≈°e bolj! üé•üñ§
